This “Safe Harbor Privacy Policy” applies with respect to individuals residing in the European Union (“EU”) and Switzerland. Convercent, Incorporated, provides a Software as a Service (“SaaS”) service to include, anonymous incident reporting system, managing and tracking company policies, managing and tracking employee education and communicating company initiatives against company values.

On the Convercent SaaS platform, clients’ employees can discreetly and anonymously report an incident, via an EU/Swiss equivalent to an 800 number or through the Convercent SaaS website. The incident reports are automatically distributed to designated recipients within the client organization.

The client can also create and manage investigations via the Convercent SaaS platform from incidents that are reported. The Convercent SaaS platform also provides clients’ with the ability to upload company policies, training materials or annotate values for the clients’ employees to attest and report adherence.

Convercent complies with the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and the U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework as set forth by the U.S. Department of Commerce regarding the collection, use and retention of personal information from European Union member countries and Switzerland. Convercent has certified that it adheres to the Safe Harbor Privacy Principles of notice, choice, onward transfer, security, data integrity, access and enforcement. To learn more about the Safe Harbor program, and to view Convercent’s certification, please visit http://www.export.gov/safeharbor/

Any data collected by Convercent will not be disclosed to third parties except where permitted or required by contract with the client. The persons authorized to receive any data collected are authorized at the direction of the client.

Convercent provides its employees education on compliance with the Safe Harbor Principles and has TRUSTe procedures in place to ensure its compliance.
